member.name: T:Microsoft.Pex.Framework.PexAssert
member.summary: A static helper class that contains a set of methods to express assertions in parameterized unit tests.
member.remarks: PexAssert is similar in behavior to Assert. The methods make various statements about the code under test. If the statement is false, the method throws . Any message in the exception object is displayed in Pex Explorer.

member.param: A message format string. The syntax for this string is identical to the format string used by Console.Writeline. In particular, insert "{0}", "{1}" and so on at appropriate locations in the string to represent the values of the variables in the array.

member.exception: Always.

member.overloads: Used to specify a location in the program that should be reached eventually.
member.remarks: Must be used in combination with .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Framework.PexAssert.ReachEventually(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a location in the program that should be reached eventually.
member.param: A string that identifies a particular ReachEventually instance.
member.remarks: This method identifies a particular goal in the code, and is typically used to identify multiple code branches that should be reached by tests. To use ReachEventually, annotate the method that contains the code branches with , and define the location string in the attribute. Then call ReachEventually in each of the branches, with set to one of the attribute's location strings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Framework.PexAssert.ReachEventually(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies a location in the program that should be reached eventually.
member.param: An integer that identifies a particular ReachEventually instance.
member.remarks: This method identifies a particular goal in the code, and is typically used to identify multiple code branches that should be reached by tests. To use ReachEventually, annotate the method that contains the code branches with set to the number of goals. Call ReachEventually in each of the branches, with set to one of the goal numbers. The goals are numbered in sequence, starting with 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Pex.Framework.PexAssume
member.summary: A static helper class that contains a set of methods to express preconditions in parameterized unit tests.
member.remarks: The PexAssume methods can be used to filter out undesirable test inputs. If the specified condition does not hold for a test input, Pex throws and silently ignores the test.

member.param: A message format string. The syntax for this string is identical to the format string used by Console.Writeline. In particular, insert "{0}", "{1}" and so on at appropriate locations in the string to represent the values of the variables in the array.

member.exception: Always.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Pex.Framework.PexChoose
member.summary: Supplies auxiliary input values to a test method.

remarks.para: PexChoose methods do not determine whether a test passes or fails, they simply specify input values. You must still use and to restrict input values and define whether a test passes or fails.

All PexChoose methods have a user-defined assigned name, which is used for purposes such as column headings in a parameter table. Some methods take a "short" name which is passed to a user-implemented object that supports INamed. The object converts the short name into a full name that is then used by Pex. The object could be used, for example, to create a scoped name from a short name, such as converting shortName to A.B.shortName.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Models.PTextReader.ReadBlock(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count characters from the current stream and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.param: When this method returns, this parameter contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count -1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of characters to read.
member.returns: The number of characters that have been read. The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether all input characters have been read.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
index or count is negative.
The buffer length minus index is less than count.
buffer is null.
The is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Models.PTextReader.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count characters from the current stream and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of characters to read. If the end of the stream is reached before count of characters is read into buffer, the current method returns.
member.returns: The number of characters that have been read. The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether the data is available within the stream. This method returns zero if called when no more characters are left to read.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
index or count is negative.
The buffer length minus index is less than count.
buffer is null.
The is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Models.PTextReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next character from the input stream and advances the character position by one character.
member.returns: The next character from the input stream, or -1 if no more characters are available. The default implementation returns -1.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Models.PTextReader.Peek
member.summary: Reads the next character without changing the state of the reader or the character source. Returns the next available character without actually reading it from the input stream.
member.returns: The next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the stream does not support seeking.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Models.PTextReader.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads a line of characters from the current stream and returns the data as a string.
member.returns: The next line from the input stream, or null if all characters have been read.
member.exception: The number of characters in the next line is larger than
An I/O error occurs.
There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
The is closed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Pex.Models.PTextReader.ReadToEnd
member.summary: Reads all characters from the current position to the end of the TextReader and returns them as one string.
member.returns: A string containing all characters from the current position to the end of the TextReader.
member.exception: The number of characters in the next line is larger than
An I/O error occurs.
There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
The is closed.
